intro: Crotalaria macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with compound leaves and spiny pods. Its botanical features include erect stems, trifoliate leaves, and flowers that are clustered in racemes. Crotalaria macrantha is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and agricultural fields.
